website_summaries.verdict: Despite taking its time to print snapshot photos and graphics-heavy documents, the Epson WorkForce 635's affordable inks and double-sided printing confirm its office suitability and earn our approval.
pros: The Epson WorkForce 635's easy-to-use control panel, streamlined construction, and rapid print speeds lend this all-in-one strong workplace credibility
cons: Moderate photo print quality and output speed will leave snapshot photographers wanting more

customer_reviews.title: To all who got 126 inks
customer_reviews.text: If you got 126 inks instead of 127 you can call 562-276-1300, press "1" and follow the prompt. Tell them about your problem and that you bought it from Amazon.com. Make sure to give them the serial number located on the back of the printer. They will send you a new set of 127 for free. Good luck. This printer is great, easy wireless setup. Mine is connected to my desktop using XP via wired internet cable and to a Mac laptop, vista laptop and window 7 laptop. All were easy to install with no problems. I was able to scan and print from all of them with ease.
customer_reviews.author: M. Shatila

customer_reviews.title: Early review
customer_reviews.text: I just purchased this printer to replace my HP 6110 all in one...the HP's scanner never worked, and eventuall, it died after about 5 years of service with printing. So not too bad with the exception of the scanner never working. The Epson was easy to set up with my XP laptop and desktop. I have a work laptop with Windows Vista on it, and there was some trouble there. I blame Vista since Vista operating system is horrible. So far printing has been very good. I have not had the opportunity to test the scanner, fax, or even copy something because I ran out of printer paper. But, I will update the review when I do those.
customer_reviews.author: Rob D

customer_reviews.title: Poor print quality
customer_reviews.text: We have had this machine for 2 years now, and it has created nothing but headaches. It will only process 24 pound and heavier paper (it eats up the 20 pound paper), the nozzles require constant cleaning, it goes through a lot of ink (especially since the nozzles are needing to be cleaned a lot), and the ink has somehow gotten on the rollers and we have been unable to clean it off so roller marks show up on all the printed pages. The customer service department could not assist us at all. Even though it still technically works, we are tossing it and getting another brand.
customer_reviews.author: mustardm

customer_reviews.title: Easy set up, very functional
customer_reviews.text: I just received the printer yesterday, had it set up in about an hour, most of the time was spent adding the printer to our three computers and going through the software process. Very simple and easy to set up, tried using the fax today, the only confusing thing was that the instructions does not tell you whether you have to place the copy face up or down on the feeder. Also the instruction says to push either the color or B & W button, the same button appears for the fax as the copier, the first time I pushed the buttons on the copier side by mistake and a copy printed instead.
customer_reviews.author: WWTRAV

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed...
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed with the quality of the printed documents. The text is not crisp, color photos are grainy, and the documents have vertical stripes. Also, our phone/fax land line suddenly stopped working (we have a shared phone/fax line). It resumed working once the phone cable was disconnected from the fax line of the All-In-One and connected directly to the wall phone jack (which means no fax function). I have done all the recommended troubleshooting steps to no avail. A "refurbished" printer is being shipped today. Not happy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Fan

customer_reviews.title: Broken upon arrival
customer_reviews.text: When I removed the printer from the box, out came a small plastic pin apparently broken off of something. It turned out to be the output tray which has two small (only one now) pins to hold it above the paper tray. We'll see what Amazon & Epson do to remedy this. Functionality & setup seem OK. Note that after it's all setup, on each computer open the Epson utility and check for driver updates. The print and scan drivers both needed updating from what was installed from the media. More testing to come!
customer_reviews.author: J. WEAVER

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this thinking it would be amazing . NOPE. And I mainly bought it to print in black and white and that turned out to be bad also because once you run out of black, it won't print . Actually once your ran out of any color it would stop printing until you refilled it. All I needed was black ink! I didn't care to print pictures or things in color. And even when it came to printing in color , It never printed color properly. It's in my closet. Why? Idk I should toss it
customer_reviews.author: Cisco X. Briano

customer_reviews.title: Great all-in-one printer.
customer_reviews.text: Received this printer last week and I'm ecstatic with the performance. Printing in quick and very clear. Paper tray could be smoother to close around paper sizes, but it holds everything nicely in place. Envelope printing is flawless as well. Initial setup was a breeze, as the software guides you through the paces with relative ease. I chose to connect via the ethernet port, as my home network is hard wired. This was a huge selling point for me, being able to print from any computer in the house via my hard wire system. Few printers offer an ethernet port. Pros: Ease of setup Looks Small footprint USB, wireless, ethernet connections Print quality and speed Cons: None so far
customer_reviews.author: Jon A. Trimble

customer_reviews.title: Not for office use
customer_reviews.text: I bought this printer because of the ability to print double sided pages and for printing pictures. The double-sided printing feature worked for about 100 pages then started to jam every time I selected that feature. The printing is not high quality. You can't print more than 3 pages at a time, and you can only print one picture at a time from the port on the front of the unit. This was a waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: WOULDN'T RECOMMEND!!
customer_reviews.text: Wasn't that crazy about this system..Didn't last long, had alot of problems!!! I replaced it with a HP 8600 and it is Much Better!!! Has alot more to offer!!! The only drawback with the HP is their ink is really expensive!!! I did not pick the Epson, I did pick- out the HP!!!
customer_reviews.author: DAH

customer_reviews.title: Compact for a all-in-one, easy to setup and use, sharp and fast prints
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to set up, even with wireless printing from a Mac. The unit is fairly compact for an all-in-one. Looks sharp. The scan menu on the unit itself doesn't allow scanning and wirelessly transmitting it to a computer. Only scan to memory card, or to the USB port. However, from the computer, you can instruct it to scan and save to a file on the computer. Would be nice to add this feature to the menu on the printer itself. Other than that, no complaints whatsoever.
customer_reviews.author: A T

customer_reviews.title: Did Lots of Research and Made the Right Choice
customer_reviews.text: Spent over a week reading reviews at various sites. My last 3 printers were HP. Got this printer last week. So far, I would say it is the best I have had to date (This is my 7th printer in my computer life). I bought it for home use especially to print out family pictures, etc. Love their ink. Much better than HP. Recommend. It was really easy to set up - both wired and wireless. Took no more than 20 minutes. FOLLOW THE DIRECTIONS!
customer_reviews.author: larrytest

customer_reviews.title: What a headache!
customer_reviews.text: I give it two stars because it works great if you don't need to connect to it (scan to print is great!). Don't bother trying to connect it to a Mac. The utilities are primative at best. Wireless scan on PC is not consistent. Getting consistent print is tough. (Get stripes through images in many cases) I am so troubled by my experience because past Epson experiences simply haven't been this bad.
customer_reviews.author: M. Walker

customer_reviews.title: epson workforce 635 all in one printer
customer_reviews.text: I had one that i now have to replace due it fell off my file cabinet and broke the cover off of the printer figured that repair would be too much well i bought one to replace it and keep the old one for spare parts if something breaks down the road but other than that i had my old one for a very long time and it was dependable no issue's....
customer_reviews.author: megabesomeone

customer_reviews.title: I love it!
customer_reviews.text: I had an HP 301 all in one printer before and it gave me nothing but trouble. The hardware ad software was always giving an error message. Support was non-existent. So far, the Epson has been great - easy to set up and easy to use. Best of all, when there was a problem in setup with one of my computers running Windows 7 64-bit, I got a real person to help me through it. I would never buy another HP. I love my Epson!
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne E. Kleiman

customer_reviews.title: Cheap Printer both in Quality and Price. Would Not Buy Again.
customer_reviews.text: Cons; Runs through ink to quickly. Not compatible with ESPN cartridges. Often stops working with them before they are out of ink. Runs through ink very quickly. Prints with lines and faded spots. Pros: Easy Wifi setup.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff D.

customer_reviews.title: Workforce 630 is excellent
customer_reviews.text: So far I'm very pleased with this all-in-one. It's fast and easy to set up and I'm particularly happy with the document feeder. It has saved me lots of time scanning wads of paper into a multi-page pdf. It's very easy to use. I've added a bulk ink system that I purchased on eBay which is now working flawlessly. I'd recommend this printer to anyone running a small office.
customer_reviews.author: George S.

customer_reviews.title: So far so good!
customer_reviews.text: Printer seems to work great and is fairly easy to use! Colors look good, photos print up nicely and the two sided printing is a cool and handy feature that we've never had before. The ink seems to be going fairly quickly but i've read that there are high capacity ink cartridges so it won't be a problem next time. For the price, you can't beat this Epson!
customer_reviews.author: Laura Wallace

customer_reviews.title: Great except for VoIP faxing
customer_reviews.text: I like everything about the Epson WorkForce 635 except its inability to fax over VoIP. I altered the fax settings as suggested in the manual, but it did not work. I understand that the problom is typical with VoIP faxing, but someone like Epson ought to be able to find an alternate method for sending/receiving faxes via VoIP with the Epson WorkForce 635.
customer_reviews.author: Brad C.

customer_reviews.title: Epson has always had the WORST printers. I remember buying Epson printers in the ...
customer_reviews.text: This broke. Epson has always had the WORST printers. I remember buying Epson printers in the 80s. They worked great for the first day or two and then they broke. This one over thirty years last is not an exception. DON"T BUY THIS BRAND!
customer_reviews.author: AlaskaSeller

customer_reviews.title: BUY THIS PRINTER
customer_reviews.text: I really can not say enough good things about this printer and I have only had it for 4 hours now. The setup was a breeze. Printing is fast with great quality. The scanning is just amazing. I am one of those people who will research for months the product I want to buy. I am so thrilled I found it and did not stay in my comfort zone of always buying HP.
customer_reviews.author: Marie Stanesic

customer_reviews.title: The Best Yet
customer_reviews.text: This is the best printer that we have owned. We actually still have six HP printers in use. None of them come close to ease of use, quality of print, speed, and they all cost at least twice as much. The Epson printer is in a new location and I have not set up a network yet to test the wireless, but I am very satisfied with everything so far. I did have to call tech support for one question about faxing. It was easier than most to get a tech and they were very helpful. This printer does everything and more than all the HP's combined. We will be replacing the HP's in our other locations with this Epson.
customer_reviews.author: Gar Parries

customer_reviews.title: Great printer! It's been working now for several years ...
customer_reviews.text: Great printer! It's been working now for several years and has had no problem. Epson ink carts are too expensive, so I buy the re-mfdg ones from 4inkjets.com. No problems with them at all. I recommend this printer!!
customer_reviews.author: T. Choate

customer_reviews.title: Excellent printer
customer_reviews.text: I researched the hell out of this purchased it on black friday for like half price. I use it mostly for printing lab reports which often include color schematics and I nothing short of pleased. It works quickly and never has a problem. It is pretty large though so ample desk space is a must. I'm not sure how it holds up to photos and all that but for office work, scanning, double-sided printing, and doing all that wirelessly it's pretty awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Tony Flight

customer_reviews.title: Function.
customer_reviews.text: This is the first time that I have written a review. I like the fact that with this printer, I can leave my phone line connected at all times as I use the same line for my faxes. I have not used the duplex features yet. It took a while to get use the front panal. The other mistake I made was when asked to indicate where or what it would it would be used for, I put business. Then each time I wanted to print, I would have to go through some steps to print. But I corredted. I don't know how. But I love the printer.
customer_reviews.author: Patsy A. Handy

customer_reviews.title: A great product. It nimbly survives my misuse
customer_reviews.text: A great product. It nimbly survives my misuse. Somewhat delicate construction and not for multi-user placement such as an office. Makes beautiful prints of photos.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Printer - Cheap INK - MAC Friendly - Great Software
customer_reviews.text: This thing is FAST... This Multifunction is MAC fully compatible EASY SETUP... CHEAP INK ONLINE... Haven't used an Epson since the Dot Matrix days...but I am a new believer. Tons of features...love the WiFi.. Can print from my iPhones/iPads/iMacs/iPod Touches.... LOVE IT!!
customer_reviews.author: GatorMan

customer_reviews.title: Easiest set up ever
customer_reviews.text: I received my Epson a few months ago and I was so glad that I was able to set it up in 15 minutes! I read the directions, installed the software, turned it on and connected my two laptops to it. I did a test print from each laptop and it worked. I have read alot of the reviews and I won't go into detail, but this was the easiest set up ever.
customer_reviews.author: Kiwi

customer_reviews.title: Great All In One Printer
customer_reviews.text: So far I am VERY pleased with this Epson WorkForce 635. Had no trouble setting it up on my wireless network. It was fast and easy. Print quality is great. Just a little noisy when printing, but no problem. Can't beat the price. Was thinking of getting an HP printer, but after my last episode with HP customer service I would NEVER buy another HP product.
customer_reviews.author: BF

customer_reviews.title: Wireless Network Installation
customer_reviews.text: The installation of this printer to my wireless network was smooth, trouble free and very quick. Everything worked as per the instructions, a very pleasant surprise! Initial printer setup took less than five minutes. So far I am very pleased with this product. I printed and copied some test files which also worked very well.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Held up great... bought a CISS for it... also use it for sublimation ink printing...
customer_reviews.author: Guy L.

customer_reviews.title: Piece of junk - broke after 5 months - Epson doesn't respect warranty
customer_reviews.text: I bought this printer hoping that I could rely on it as a home printer-all in one. At first, I was happy, but then after a few months of light use a wheel fell off the back of the printer. I went to Epson's website to replace the part, but learned that I needed to replace the entire printer. I assumed that Epson would respect the one year warrantee, but they didn't. I will never purchase another product from Epson. Moreover, the people on the help line were quite rude.
customer_reviews.author: KS

customer_reviews.title: Love it but software issue
customer_reviews.text: Be aware that there may be a software issue. Installed the software from the Epson CD (Disk vol. 1.2) and kept getting the message "some files necessary for setup are not installed" After a couple attempts (with firewall and antivirus turned off) I went to Epson's website and downloaded the software. Everything worked fine. I'm running Windows 7, 64 bit. Other than that the wireless setup was seamless. As far as all of the other features my comments mirror all of the positive comments from the other reviewers. Great value.
customer_reviews.author: BuffyJo

customer_reviews.title: Love the design, color and multi-functionality.
customer_reviews.text: Sleek design, and it gets the job done whether copying, printing, scanning or faxing.
customer_reviews.author: YTY

customer_reviews.title: Epson Workforce 635
customer_reviews.text: I really like the Epson Workforce. I usually buy HP, but after getting disappointing machines and poor customer service the last 2 times, I decided to go with an Epson All-in-one. The Epson is fast, very easy to use and produces quality print outs. The only reason I gave it 4 stars instead of 5 is because the tray is flimsy and awkward. I wish they would have a sturdier replacement tray. I can live with that because the machine is a great buy.
customer_reviews.author: F. Catherine McCulloch

customer_reviews.title: Quality Epson
customer_reviews.text: This printer has never made a bad copy and has never done a bad print. Cartridges last a long time and do not dry out when not used for an extended period.
customer_reviews.author: Nate

customer_reviews.title: Love it, Love it
customer_reviews.text: Love it, Love it, Love it!!! Use it for my home office and it prints fast! Do not like the occasional cartridge error.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Gulden

customer_reviews.title: Epson Workforce 635 Printer
customer_reviews.text: After having researched printer after printer I was really after something with excellent scanning quality. This printer is very easy to set-up. It found my wireless router easily, loaded the drivers effortlessly, just make sure you have an USB connection for set-up. It prints wirelessly, scans wirelessly, including double sided scanning, crucial to me. I have not had it long, but the print quality is excellent and the scanning is a snap with an icon loaded right onto the desktop. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: gordorf

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Printer, Excellent Price.
customer_reviews.text: The printer is great, the price was good. The setup was easy. The put the paper on tray and/or removing and putting the tray in requires a little practice (blow air between sheets) The Automatic Document Feeder is Awesome. The Duplex printing Great. Print quality/ink is excellent. Dual side copying requires practice, but it is automatic, choose always the 2 to 2 side option if you don't want to read or figure it out. It is quiet and it is lovely!
customer_reviews.author: LouiO

customer_reviews.title: Avoid this printer
customer_reviews.text: The ink refills are exorbitant in cost and Epson makes it impossible to use generic ink. I HATE THIS PRINTER because of the high ink cost. I'm ditching it and getting one that can use cheap[er] ink. Otherwise, the printer functioned very well. :-(
customer_reviews.author: Susan Tordella-williams

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: Its been a month I have used it and have not run into any major problem. I love the wifi connection to all the computers in the home. I just dare not tried to check the price of the ink in an event I run out of it (thats where the real markup is, isn't it?)
customer_reviews.author: AMG

customer_reviews.title: epson printer
customer_reviews.text: I haven't used the printer but just a couple of times. I found that installing it to be one of the easiest things ever. no problems at all.so far very pleased, now just need something to print.
customer_reviews.author: cavs

customer_reviews.title: Scans Documents Wirelessly...
customer_reviews.text: I've used several different color printers in the past and I can honestly say I was very pleased with my new Epson WorkForce 635. Once configured, wireless printing works flawlessly for me. Quality of print even on plain paper is great - you can barely see the difference, if any, compared to black & white document printed on a laser printer. I like the fact that I can wirelessly scan documents in to my laptop from this printer. Also, automatic document feeder workes good thus far. I would recommend this printer!
customer_reviews.author: Gloss

customer_reviews.title: Printer
customer_reviews.text: This printer is just what I wanted for our personal home use and home office.It was also priced right and shipped out fast.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Jay Smith

customer_reviews.title: Epson 635 Printer
customer_reviews.text: Install was very easy. Driver update was downloaded without problem from internet. Print quality is very good. So far, so good. Installed and running in about 10 - 15 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: ScottL

customer_reviews.text: The printer works great. The problem is the Wireless part. I still haven't figured out how to set it up. I've had 2 people try. Thank goodness being wireless is not a prioity at the moment.
customer_reviews.author: OkieMom

customer_reviews.title: Fast!
customer_reviews.text: Great product; easy to set up and use wirelessly. Fast printing and scanning. Can't comment on price of ink because I haven't bought any yet
customer_reviews.author: Memphis GG

customer_reviews.title: Christmas gift
customer_reviews.text: My son says it was the best for his needs. I am sure that he is satisfied with the gift.
customer_reviews.author: Dorothy Carey

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good.
customer_reviews.text: Easy set up, worked nicely right out of the box. Much quieter than previous printer (Canon). Pretty easy to use and understand how functions work.
customer_reviews.author: tjcnok

customer_reviews.title: Very nice ink jet printer
customer_reviews.text: Worked well right out of the box. No problems setting it up. I have a Macintosh computer and it works well with it.
customer_reviews.author: limell

customer_reviews.title: Very good but
customer_reviews.text: The Epson Workforce 635 is almost perfect, if you want an ultrafast all in one this is the one to get, what I mean by almost, is because I previously owned a HP all in one and the software was nicer,faster and easier. I would definitely buy the Epson instead of the HP but, the software on the Epson could be better.
customer_reviews.author: J. Nuno

customer_reviews.title: Comparison
customer_reviews.text: I had a dell for 2 years-had nothing but trouble and was buying ink every other week. The epson is quiet, efficient and hasn't used an ink cartridge yet. I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Charlies Place

customer_reviews.title: Great Printer
customer_reviews.text: I was currently using a Canon Pixma MP 950 which was great but had no fax, my new Epson is very compact and prints like lighting, set up is very simple. My only concerns are that the paper outfeed seems fragile and when its printing it seems noisey other than this machine is great.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Epson WorkForcxe 635
customer_reviews.text: Is an excellent job partner; the cartridge inks cost as a new printer, but the marketing is this: Buy news cartridges, because is our best profit
customer_reviews.author: Jose Gutierrez

customer_reviews.title: Not A TeckiesReview
customer_reviews.text: I'm 66 yrs old and not to good with new tech stuff. My new Epson 635 was easy to install and gave my excellent high quality print-outs from day one. I am very pleased with this product and would recommend it to anyone interested in producing high quality professional looking documents in their home or office.
customer_reviews.author: Ralphie

customer_reviews.title: A great all in one printer ar last!!
customer_reviews.text: It was easy to set up and runs like a dream! My network router found it right away and set it up.
customer_reviews.author: Roy E. Young

customer_reviews.title: Good multi-function printer for the money
customer_reviews.text: Does all it is supposed to do. Seems to stretch ink cartridges pretty far. All in all, no disappointments.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: Does not support Google CloudPrint
customer_reviews.text: Ugh. Why would Epson make a "modern" wireless-enabled printer that doesn't support Google CloudPrint!? We have chrome books in our house, so the wireless functionality is next to useless. Sending this back.
customer_reviews.author: Ajax Fan

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this printer. I have had it for several years now and it still works very well.
customer_reviews.author: Vivaldigirl

customer_reviews.title: A Nice Little Printer
customer_reviews.text: I really like the reliability of this printer. It scans, prints and copies without errors--no paper jams!! Yeah. It's easy to use. I use it as my general purpose printer and I'm quite pleased with its performance.
customer_reviews.author: Sam M

customer_reviews.title: setup
customer_reviews.text: received printer and took about an hour to set up. i'm not computer literate but seemed pretty easy. this review box popped up before i had a chance to test product but am confident all will be o.k. at least hope so. i have had other epson products and had no problems.
customer_reviews.author: chris

customer_reviews.title: Epson WorkForce 635
customer_reviews.text: This printer is amazing, anyone that is looking to purchase a new printer should consider this one. It is well worth the money and very little money it cost. What a wonderful product and the prints are simply amazing. Love it, Love it, Love it. Thanks Epson
customer_reviews.author: mrlbattle

customer_reviews.title: Great Printer
customer_reviews.text: This printer is great! It can do 2 sided printing with ease. This printer works for my use and I would recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: This is a very easy to install and use device. I have three of the same model. I recommended.
customer_reviews.author: ZFD

customer_reviews.title: Great All-in-One printer
customer_reviews.text: This is a compact, well built, attractive, and inexpensive printer that scans, prints, faxes (stand alone), and copies efficiently, and fast. This is a lot of printer forth price.
customer_reviews.author: Npog99

customer_reviews.title: Like it!
customer_reviews.text: It is very easy to setup. I spent less than half hour and got my computer to print and scan. It does print quite slowly as warned by some reviews.
customer_reviews.author: oc

customer_reviews.title: My Epson
customer_reviews.text: Excellent, simple to set up, great quality. Would buy again. Everything they said it was and more! Amazon has never let me down.
customer_reviews.author: Craig

customer_reviews.title: Epson workforce 635
customer_reviews.text: This printer is great! Easy setup and connecting to your personnal network is easy. Serious printer at a very affordable price.
customer_reviews.author: Juanvangie

customer_reviews.title: Very good
customer_reviews.text: Very good printer at an excellent price so far. I am very glad with it. Hope this message is useful.
customer_reviews.author: Eugenio

customer_reviews.title: mm
customer_reviews.text: I had a mfp phaser. The Epson is far superior, simple to operate, compact. The color is adequate but for the price can't beat it. Took me less than 15 minutes to install.
customer_reviews.author: mahesh melwani

customer_reviews.title: Wrong ink in printer's what is in the box section
customer_reviews.text: In the printer's "What's in the Box" it says 127 series cartridges but I received 126 series with my order
customer_reviews.author: NT

product_meta.title: Epson WorkForce 635 Color Inkjet All-in-One (C11CA69201)
product_meta.description:
Take your productivity to new heights with the WorkForce 635, the all-in-one that brings you the world's fastest one- and two-sided. Print speeds in its class, automatic, two-sided printing/copying, and a two-sided Automatic Document Feeder (ADF). Blazing through critical tasks at speeds of 15 ISO ppm (black) and 7.2 ISO ppm (color), the WorkForce 635 has 127 Extra High-capacity Black inks available, so you get 2x more prints per cartridge, which means less time spent replacing cartridges2. And, with automatic, two-sided printing/copying, you can save up to 50% of your paper supply. When you need to print multiple pages, load up the 250-sheet paper tray. There's no need to waste time re-loading paper in the middle of the job. If you have stacks of originals, use the 30-page two-sided ADF to quickly copy, scan or fax one- or two-sided documents. With instant-dry DURABrite Ultra Ink, the WorkForce 635 delivers prints that are smudge, fade and water resistant, so you can share them immediately after printing. And, you can easily share your all-in-one — Easy Epson Wi-Fi networking makes wireless printing from multiple PCs simple3. This powerful, yet compact product was built for businesses. And, it uses up to 70% less power than laser printers.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER


 WORKFORCE® 635 ALL-IN-ONE
SUPERIOR PERFORMANCE
Take your productivity to new heights with the WorkForce 635, the all-in-one that brings you the world's fastest one- and two-sided .Print | Copy | Scan | Fax | Wi-Fiprint speeds in its class1, automatic, two-sided printing/copying, and a two-sided Automatic Document Feeder (ADF). Blazing through critical tasks at speeds of 15 ISO ppm (black) and 7.2 ISO ppm (color)†, the WorkForce 635 has 127 Extra High-capacity Black inks available, so you get 2x more prints per cartridge, which means less time spent replacing cartridges2. And, with automatic, two-sided printing/copying, you can save up to 50% of your paper supply. When you need to print multiple pages, load up the 250-sheet paper tray. There's no need to waste time re-loading paper in the middle of the job. If you have stacks of originals, use the 30-page two-sided ADF to quickly copy, scan or fax one- or two-sided documents. With instant-dry DURABrite® Ultra Ink, the WorkForce 635 delivers prints that are smudge, fade and water resistant, so you can share them immediately after printing. And, you can easily share your all-in-one — Easy Epson Wi-Fi networking makes wireless printing from multiple PCs simple3. This powerful, yet compact product was built for businesses. And, it uses up to 70% less power than laser printers4. 



What the press is saying:

“The Epson WorkForce 635 has a lot to offer a small office, with its good speed and print quality, and especially its affordable inks.” PCWorld, Jon L. Jacobi and Melissa Riofrio (March 28th, 2011) 




Fast speeds for any small business or home office As the world's fastest all-in-one in both single- and two-sided printing1, the WorkForce 635 features ISO print speeds of 15 ISO ppm (black) and 7.2 ISO ppm (color), plus two-sided ISO print speeds of 7.5 ISO ppm (black) and 4.5 ISO ppm (color)†. With the WorkForce 635, you get great quality, without sacrificing speed. The WorkForce 635 makes it easy to work more efficiently. With automatic, two-sided printing, you can easily save paper, without any user intervention. Or, use the built-in, 30-page Auto Document Feeder to quickly copy, scan and fax stacks of one- or two-sided documents. Fax in as fast as 3 seconds per page, save up to 180 pages in memory, and store up to 60 numbers. With the included PC-Fax5, you can even send a fax right from your computer. It's a great way to save time and paper!

Built-in Easy Epson Wi-Fi Use the built-in Wi-Fi for easy wireless printing or to share your all-in-one among multiple computers. Quickly set up, connect and print from any networked computer. Because the Workforce 635 offers the latest Wi-Fi n support, you get 2.5 times the performance of the previous 802.11b3.



EpsonCompetitor 

Professional quality output without compromise Print proposals, reports and brochures with high quality color and crisp, sharp text. While many competitive inks often take several minutes to dry, prints made with instant-dry DURABrite Ultra Ink allow you to handle documents and photos immediately after printing. Prints are smudge, fade and water resistant, so it's easier than ever to protect important documents.



Convenient scanning features Scan and save electronic copies of printed reports, or turn forms and documents into editable text with the OCR software included. You can even scan-to-PDF, then quickly archive and search important files. When you use the WorkForce 635 to scan in a document, and you're connected wirelessly, you can specify which computer you'd like to send the file to. Use the front-side USB port on the printer to upload files from any thumb drive straight to your PC.


Additional features that save you time and money 127 Extra High-capacity Black ink cartridges are also available and give you about 2x more prints per cartridge2. So, you can print more and change cartridges less often. Plus, individual ink cartridges give you control over ink usage. Replace only the cartridge you need! The built-in, large paper tray holds up to 250 sheets of plain paper, so you don't have to interrupt your busy day to attend to your printer. Saving is easy with the WorkForce 635 – you save money and paper. In fact, with automatic, two-sided printing, you can save up to 50% of your paper supply. And, you can save energy too because the WorkForce 635 uses up to 70% less power than laser printers4.


Product protection you can count on

With the WorkForce 635, you get phone support, without charge, for the life of the product.6 And, when you register your product, you'll enjoy benefits such as free, downloadable business templates and "how to" tutorials. The WorkForce 635 comes with a one-year limited warranty, which includes quick product exchange, plus dependable service and support.


Quickly print from your mobile device Do more with your Epson printer and your mobile device. Wi Fi - enabled Epson printers now work with several mobile applications to print photos, PDFs, Word documents, web pages and more! No need to use photo sharing websites and wait for your prints or print them out at your nearest drug store. You can now also print emails & attachments anywhere you go - at home, in the office or on the road. Get performance printing on the go with Epson mobile printing. See www.epson.com/mobileprinting for more information.


The new international ISO print speed standard Print speed is critically important when buying a printer or all-in-one. But how do you compare print speeds when different manufacturers measure in different ways? Now you can. Much like the "MPG" ratings on new cars, there's now a new industry standard for measuring print speed, which allows for an "apples-to-apples" comparison between different printer models and brands. The International Organization for Standardization (widely known as ISO) developed this industry approved and internationally accepted standard, specifically for ink jet printers and all-in-ones. It measures "out of the box" (default) print speeds using "real world" printing scenarios, so you can be sure you're getting a product that performs at the speed you need.


Features/Benefits

 * Save time — with the world's fastest all-in-one in both one- and two-sided printing1
 * Speed through critical documents — ISO print speeds of 15 ISO ppm (black) and 7.2 ISO ppm (color), two-sided print speeds of 7.5 ISO ppm (black) and 4.5 ISO ppm (color)†
 * Save paper — save up to 50% of your paper supply with automatic, two-sided printing
 * Print twice as much — get about 2x more prints with 127 Extra High-capacity Black ink cartridges2
 * Individual ink cartridges — replace only the color you need
 * Less hassle — built-in 250-sheet paper tray means you re-load paper less often
 * Do more — 30-page Auto Document Feeder to quickly copy, scan or fax stacks of originals
 * Easy wireless printing — built-in Easy Epson Wi-Fi makes wireless setup, networking and printing fast and easy3
 * PC-Fax — fax documents directly from your computer5
 * Front USB port — insert thumb drive and upload files directly to your PC
 * High-speed faxing in black and color — as fast as 3 sec per page; speed dial storage up to 60 numbers; fax memory up to 180 pages
 * Protect important documents — smudge, fade and water resistant prints; documents rival those from a laser printer
 * Save energy — uses up to 70% less power than laser printers4
 * Product protection you can count on — one-year limited warranty; phone support, without charge, for the life of the product6; plus, get free templates and "how to" tutorials
 * Packaging Specifications (W x D x H) — Dimensions: Printing 17.6" x 21.9" x 9.1", Storage 17.6" x 14.2" x 8.9" and Weight 16.8 lb.





WHAT'S IN THE BOX

 * Instruction manual
 * CD-ROM with drivers and bonus software
 * Free sample paper pack
 * Power cord
 * Telephone cord
 * Four DURABrite Ultra Ink cartridges:
 * Four 126-series Extra High-capacity ink cartridges: Black, Cyan, Magenta, Yellow)

EPSON INK SUPPLIES

 * 126 DURABrite Ultra High-capacity Cyan ink cartridge (T126220)

EPSON PAPER SUPPLIES  * Premium Presentation Paper Matte 8.5 x 11 in, 50 sheets (S041257)
 * Bright White Paper 8.5 x 11 in, 500 sheets (S041586)
 * Presentation Paper Matte 8.5 x 11 in, 100 sheets (S041062)
 * Premium Photo Paper Semi-gloss 8.5 x 11 in, 20 sheets (S041331)
 * Premium Photo Paper Glossy 4 x 6 in, 100 sheets (S041727)





THE WORKFORCE SERIES
Engineered for Business. Small businesses have big expectations. That's why WorkForce, Epson's exclusive line of high-performance ink jet printers and all-in-ones, was designed with small businesses in mind. Now, you can get laser quality prints at the world's fastest speeds1, plus easy setup, high-capacity, instant-dry inks, and the freedom to print wirelessly — all from a brand you can rely on.








Eco features 

 * Uses up to 70% less power than laser printers4
 * Save up to 50% on paper with manual, two-sided printing
 * ENERGY STAR® qualified
 * Designed to be Recycled7
 * Epson America, Inc. is a SmarWaySM Transport Partner8





†What is ISO ppm?

ISO ppm is based on the new international standard for measuring print speed. Black and color print speeds are determined in default, single-side mode, in accordance with ISO/ IEC 24734. Actual print times will vary based on system configuration, software, and page complexity. See www.epson.com/printspeed for details, including complete ISO reports.






 1. Fastest in its class; 50% faster than the competition printing black text in default, single-side mode, in accordance with ISO/IEC 24734. Compared to ink jet all-in-ones priced at $199 or less, as of September 2009, based on independent testing.
 2. Get about two times more prints per cartridge compared with our 126 Black ink cartridge.
 3. Wi-Fi 802.11 b/g/n certified; level of performance subject to the range of the router being used. Visit www.wi-fi.org/files/11nbasics_glossary.pdf for more information.
 4. Compared to the best-selling monochrome and color multifunction laser printers available for $499 or less as of January 1, 2009. Actual power savings will vary by product model and usage.
 5. For sending faxes only.
 6. Epson provides phone support without charge for the life of the product. Telephone toll charges may apply.
 7. See our website for convenient and reasonable recycling options at www.epson.com/recycle
 8. SmartWay is an innovative partnership of the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency that reduces greenhouse gases and other air pollutants and improves fuel efficiency.

Jon Konrath1.0 out of 5 stars Great replacement for my old HPReviewed in the United States on March 7, 2011Verified Purchase I've had an HP PhotoSmart C5280 for about three years, and I figured that I could either buy my next two ink refills, or just buy another printer that had more of the features I wanted. I've been pretty happy with this printer so far. I haven't used all of its features yet, but I immediately tried out the big differences to make sure this would be a winner for me.

Double-sided printing - The instruction manuals are not that clear on this, because they use the same one for all 63x printers. But this one DOES do double-sided printing. Just select the option in the print setup dialog box, and no crazy acrobatics are involved with printing the odd pages, then reloading the printed ones and printing the even pages. You just print, it goes, and will print on both sides of the page just like every book published in the last 600 years. Your paper bill has been halved, no questions asked.

Wifi - works awesome. I plugged in my router and password, and suddenly all of my Mac computers could see the Epson in their Bonjour print sharing.

Mac setup - I've got three Macs here, so I didn't want to get stuck with something that insisted on me running a SETUP.EXE file to print. No problems, though - I found the printer in Bonjour, and when I added it, it went and downloaded then installed a driver from Apple's web site. Within a couple of clicks, my OSX 10.6 machines were printing away. And when I went to Preview and did a File > Import from Scanner > Include Networked Devices, it magically saw the Epson and let me scan from it.

ADF - This thing has a document feeder, so you can just dump that pile of a dozen or two pages in the top and let it pull in each page as it scans. No more sitting around waiting for the page to scan so you can open the lid and drop in a new page. (You can open the scanner lid for your odd-sized items that don't fit in the ADF, like your butt.)

The only minus I see so far is that the paper tray isn't that great. It's one of those things where three sides of it have adjustable runners so if you're printing photos or your country's money still has a picture of a Queen on it and you have some weird metric paper, you can adjust. I wish it had a lock or something to keep it in the standard 8.5x11 configuration, because I will eventually load it up crooked and jam the thing.

1/3/12 update: I've dropped my review to 1 and would drop it to zero, based solely on the piece of garbage tray. It is almost impossible to reload the tray in under 91724917 tries. There are two slides holding the paper. When you adjust one, you knock the other one out of adjustment. Readjust that one, you knock the other one. If you get both of them, there is a 99% chance the paper is loaded askew by about ten degrees. And the tray does not cleanly push into the printer. If you try to push too hard, it locks or freezes and you have to pull it out. There is a 100% chance when you pull it free, you will knock one or both slides out of place and have to start over. I am two seconds from going Office Space on this thing, and the only two things stopping me are that I just bought this, and I don't have a baseball bat in the house.Read more 10 people found this helpful Helpful Comment Report abuse Regular Joe4.0 out of 5 stars Solid Home Office All-In-OneReviewed in the United States on July 22, 2011Verified Purchase Our flatbed scanner died and my daughter's new MacBook Pro didn't support my ancient HP. Plus the kids were always whining about the slowness of the old HP. After much research I settled on the Epson Workforce 635 as the best balance of features for my needs. In particular, the things I like:

- Fast start-up (typically the first page starts printing after 10 seconds of warm-up coming off a long idle period)
- Plain text pages are printing about 20 per minute (haven't tried any pictures yet)
- Duplex (2 sided) printing right out of the box
- Drivers for Windows XP, Windows 7, the Mac and my kids iPhones (uses a free application not the "cooler" Airprint support by HP). The iPhone app was recently upgraded to support document printing in addition to pictures.
- Duplex copier works as advertised and has a 30 page document feeder in addition to the flatbed scanner, I haven't tried the scan to PC feature or the FAX.

The printer supports wireless networking or hardwired Ethernet (it's either one or the other, you can't hook both networks up at the same time). I chose wireless so the kids could print from their iPhones. Set-up was painless and worked the first time.

Ink usage seems to be as advertised. I purchased extra cartridges just because another reviewer mentioned nothing on the printer works if any cartridge goes empty, but I'm still on the set that came with the printer.

If it lasts as long as my HP did, I'll be really happy (and no, the kids haven't stopped whining).Read more 2 people found this helpful Helpful Comment Report abuse Long-Suffering Technology Consumer4.0 out of 5 stars "all-in-one" no longer means "none done well"...Reviewed in the United States on October 1, 2011Verified Purchase ...this all in one does an excellent job at all four of its tasks: printing, scanning, copying and faxing.

Way back when, audiophiles were convinced of a direct relationship between the number of separate components you had and the quality of sound that came out of them. The concept of an "all in one" anything meant none of the functions would be done well. Nine years ago, when I bought my first inexpensive all in one, this old audiophile concept held up: it was pretty bad at all of its functions (print, scan, copy).

Good news, everyone: those days are gone.

The Workmate 635 does all of four of its functions pretty well, and offers three connection options (USB, Ethernet and wireless). I chose Ethernet (to free up a rear USB port on the desktop it's paired with). It holds 250 sheets of paper, and lets you print from memory cards and make copies without being connected to a computer. This is the fastest inkjet printer I've ever used.

Image scanning offers options to save as .jpg, .bmp, .pdf or .tif formats. Bundled OCR software allows you to scan text documents into editable Word and .pdf formats.

Two small things keep this from five stars: printing may be fast, but is also rather noisy...especially when printing text. Also, even though the included drivers on the installation CD claimed to have installed successfully, they did not. After visiting the Epson website, I was able to download the most current drivers, and then it installed fine.

Overall, an excellent performer at this price.Read more One person found this helpful Helpful Comment Report abuse See all reviews from the United States

 * Protect important documents — smudge, fade and water resistant prints; documents rival those from a laser printer
 * Save energy — uses up to 70% less power than laser printers4
 * Product protection you can count on — one-year limited warranty; phone support, without charge, for the life of the product6; plus, get free templates and "how to" tutorials
 * Packaging Specifications (W x D x H) — Dimensions: Printing 17.6" x 21.9" x 9.1", Storage 17.6" x 14.2" x 8.9" and Weight 16.8 lb.

THE WORKFORCE SERIES
Engineered for Business. Small businesses have big expectations. That's why WorkForce, Epson's exclusive line of high-performance ink jet printers and all-in-ones, was designed with small businesses in mind. Now, you can get laser quality prints at the world's fastest speeds1, plus easy setup, high-capacity, instant-dry inks, and the freedom to print wirelessly — all from a brand you can rely on.








Eco features 

 * Uses up to 70% less power than laser printers4
 * Save up to 50% on paper with manual, two-sided printing
 * ENERGY STAR® qualified
 * Designed to be Recycled7
 * Epson America, Inc. is a SmarWaySM Transport Partner8





†What is ISO ppm?

ISO ppm is based on the new international standard for measuring print speed. Black and color print speeds are determined in default, single-side mode, in accordance with ISO/ IEC 24734. Actual print times will vary based on system configuration, software, and page complexity. See www.epson.com/printspeed for details, including complete ISO reports.






 1. Fastest in its class; 50% faster than the competition printing black text in default, single-side mode, in accordance with ISO/IEC 24734. Compared to ink jet all-in-ones priced at $199 or less, as of September 2009, based on independent testing.
 2. Get about two times more prints per cartridge compared with our 126 Black ink cartridge.
 3. Wi-Fi 802.11 b/g/n certified; level of performance subject to the range of the router being used. Visit www.wi-fi.org/files/11nbasics_glossary.pdf for more information.
 4. Compared to the best-selling monochrome and color multifunction laser printers available for $499 or less as of January 1, 2009. Actual power savings will vary by product model and usage.
 5. For sending faxes only.
 6. Epson provides phone support without charge for the life of the product. Telephone toll charges may apply.
 7. See our website for convenient and reasonable recycling options at www.epson.com/recycle
 8. SmartWay is an innovative partnership of the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency that reduces greenhouse gases and other air pollutants and improves fuel efficiency.
